item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: Solution:
Introduce dynamic calldata pricing:
10 gas for zero bytes, 40 for non-zero bytes-> for data-heavy transactions
Keep old calldata cost structure for regular/compute-transactions.
Basically making it more costly and less attractive to use calldata for DA purposes.

item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: TLDR on EIP-7623
Problem: As pointed out by @blocknative L2s can save money by opportunistically switching between calldata and blob space for DA.
However this causes spikes in block sizes when calldata becomes cheaper than blob space.
The high variance in block size strains the network, slows block propagation and stresses nodes.
https://x.com/blocknative/status/1806043723538821609

item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: As much as I am excited about EIP 7702 I also have a concern which I already mentioned in the past.
When I onboard my mom under EIP 7702, she will still need an EOA to start of with and hence be familiar with private keys. Cause no matter the smart wallet implementation she upgrades that EOA to, the EOA's private key will always have the ultimate power.. Maybe there is some nice embedded wallet with @privy_io that combines with eip 7702?
Master powers remain though..
Alternatively, is the following flow feasible?
Create EOA -> Upgrade EOA to smart wallet with alternative auth logic -> Delete existence of private key?
Appreciate any input on this üôè https://x.com/letsgetonchain/status/1878545580265553927
